channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: 'It's turned crazy': Inside the scramble for Trump pardons
item.description: President Donald Trump may not be willing to accept his term is ending, but as the clock ticks down on his time in office, hundreds of his allies -- including some of his closest business associates and many high-profile criminals -- are ramping up their efforts to squeeze out the final ounces of his presidential power.

item.title: McConnell has an 'election fraud' problem
Avlon: 'Trump derangement syndrome' has taken on a new twist
item.description: CNN's John Avlon looks back at presidential 'derangement syndromes' and how the current one is afflicting President Trump and his supporters.

item.title: Hill leaders eye new round of stimulus checks as part of $900 billion Covid relief deal
item.description: Congressional leaders, after months of a bitter stalemate and as millions of Americans have been eager for relief, are finally indicating they're nearing a deal on a new rescue package that could pass both chambers within days.

item.title: How Europe is handling a Covid-19 Christmas
Pfizer working to get details of reported allergic reaction to vaccination in Alaska, company says
See this airline's new Covid-19 'Safety Dance'
item.description: Alaska Airlines wants you to fly with them -- so much so, that they're willing to dance for you. The airline showed off its Covid-19 safety precautions with a new music video.

item.title: Biden introduces Pete Buttigieg as transportation secretary nominee Wednesday
item.description: President-elect Joe Biden will introduce former South Bend, Indiana, Mayor Pete Buttigieg as his nominee for transportation secretary at an event in Wilmington, Delaware on Wednesday.

item.title: Buttigieg on the significance of nomination: I'm mindful 'the eyes of history are on this appointment'
Russian minister says Navalny poisoning reports 'funny to read'
item.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said Wednesday that reports about the details surrounding the poisoning of opposition figure Alexey Navalny are "funny to read," in an apparent reference to a CNN-Bellingcat investigation into the attack.

item.title: Trump sees special counsel investigations of Hunter Biden and election claims as payback for Russia probe
item.description: President Donald Trump is pushing extensively for the appointment of special counsels to separately investigate his baseless allegations of voter fraud and allegations surrounding Hunter Biden, the son of the President-elect, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Pompeo quarantining after coronavirus exposure
item.description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo is quarantining after coming into contact with someone who tested positive for coronavirus, but he himself "has been tested and is negative," the State Department announced Wednesday.

item.title: This dad spent 30 hours getting a tattoo of his son's birthmark
item.description: Derek Prue Sr. decided to get the tattoo after noticing his eight-year-old son insisted on wearing a shirt to the pool.

item.title: Air pollution a cause of nine-year-old girl's death, landmark ruling finds
item.description: A nine-year-old girl who died after an asthma attack is thought to be the first person in the world to have air pollution listed as a cause of death in a landmark coroner's ruling.

item.title: Here's when the largest snowfall is expected to hit the Northeast
item.description: • Live updates: Snow storm heads toward the Northeast

item.title: Keilar: There's no path for Trump, it's a brick wall
item.description: CNN's Brianna Keilar talks about the many GOP officials who said they would acknowledge Joe Biden as president-elect after the electoral college voted and have yet to recognize the win a day after the vote.

item.title: How Trump is fueling the alarming growth of QAnon
item.description: It started with a Tweet from a QAnon supporter at 2:09 in the morning: #SubpoenaObama.

item.title: A mayor received so many threats after supporting a mask mandate that she resigned
item.description: A Kansas mayor has resigned after backlash to comments she made in support of a mask mandate in her city.

item.title: Former Houston police captain charged with pointing gun at air-conditioner repairman, believing he was a voter fraud 'mastermind'
item.description: A former police captain who was part of a private citizens group investigating still unsubstantiated 2020 election fraud claims was charged Tuesday with running a man off the road and pointing a gun to his head two weeks before the election, the Harris County district attorney said in a statement.

item.title: Pakistan toughens rape law after outcry over attacks
item.description: Pakistan introduced a rape law on Tuesday that will create special courts to try cases within four months, after protests over the gang rape of a woman whose car ran out of fuel.

item.title: Paris mayor mocks fine imposed for hiring too many senior women
item.description: The mayor of Paris has branded as "absurd" a €90,000 ($109,369) fine imposed for appointing "too many women" to management positions.

item.title: 5,000-year-old relic from the Great Pyramid discovered in a cigar box in Scotland
item.description: Late last year, curatorial assistant Abeer Eladany was reviewing items in the University of Aberdeen's museum collections, when she came across an item that didn't seem to belong.

item.title: Boko Haram claims responsibility for kidnapping, prompting fear of increasing influence
item.description: Boko Haram has claimed responsibility for the kidnapping of over 30 schoolboys in northwestern Nigeria. Although CNN was unable to independently verify the authenticity of the message, if the claims are true it would indicating that Boko Haram has widened its influence far beyond its stronghold. CNN's David McKenzie reports.

item.title: Bill Gates, Amazon and British Airways are backing a hydrogen plane startup
item.description: A California-based startup that promises to make zero-carbon flight a reality has just received a major vote of confidence.

item.title: Peruvian police dress as Santa and elves for drug raid
item.description: A family of alleged drug dealers in Peru found themselves firmly on the naughty list this year as police officers dressed as Santa and an elf raided their home.

item.title: Chaos at the top of China's biggest chipmaker
item.description: The C-suite of one of China's most important tech companies has just been thrown into confusion.

item.title: Religious leaders call for global ban on so-called gay conversion therapies
item.description: Hundreds of religious leaders have joined forces to push for a global ban on gay conversion therapies, treatments that claim to be able to change a person's sexual orientation or identity.

item.title: This robotaxi from Amazon's Zoox has no reverse function
item.description: This self-driving robotaxi from Amazon's Zoox can travel up to 75 mph and never has to turn around. Check out this electric vehicle made for crowded city streets.

item.title: Why we started an airline during a pandemic
item.description: For many airlines, 2020 has been a precarious year -- with carriers navigating not just how to keep employees and passengers safe, but also how to avoid bankruptcy and layoffs as the pandemic grinds global air traffic to a halt.

item.title: Woman loses dog under massive amounts of sea foam
item.description: Several people jumped into action to save a dog that got lost under massive amounts of sea foam covering an Australian beach.

item.title: 'Salon under the sea' submarine dives to 1,000 meters
item.description: Stepping off a yacht and diving to the depths of the ocean in a transparent submarine might sound like an elaborate scene from a James Bond movie.

item.title: China's luxury market boomed this year, even as global sales shrank
item.description: China's luxury market has proved "unstoppable" this year even as the coronavirus pandemic hammered global demand for expensive goods.

item.title: Negro Leagues recognized as official major leagues, stats to be added to MLB records
item.description: Major League Baseball on Wednesday sought to correct a longstanding wrong by recognizing the Negro Leagues as a major league and counting the statistics and records of thousands of Black players as part of the game's storied history.

item.title: Kangaroos can ask humans for help, new study shows
item.description: It may sound a bit "Dr. Doolittle," but it turns out kangaroos can communicate with humans.

item.title: Australian police charge man in alleged international table tennis match-fixing syndicate
item.description: Australian police have charged a man as part of an ongoing investigation into an alleged transnational gambling syndicate placing corrupt bets on international table tennis tournaments.

item.title: At the world's oldest opera house, the show must go on
item.description: The world's oldest opera house, the Teatro di San Carlo in Italy, has survived wars, fires and the Neapolitan revolution. But this year, as the theater launches its winter season program, the doors to the public have remained closed. The theater has not seen a live audience since March, the longest time in its history, due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: When the check hit her bank account, winning golfer suspected 'illegal activity'
item.description: It had got to the point in her career that golfer Sophia Popov was contemplating trying her hand at something else.

item.title: YouTuber Jake Paul offers UFC fighter Conor McGregor $50 million to box him
item.description: YouTuber Jake Paul is trying to capitalize on his initial success in the boxing ring by challenging former UFC champion Conor McGregor.

item.title: Kelly Clarkson tears up at pupil's song on 'The Voice'
item.description: Kelly Clarkson cried while praising her pupil and "The Voice" contestant, DeSz, for her original song on the season 19 finale.

item.title: The holidays are often when Americans see family, but many are canceling this year
item.description: No Christmas Eve dinners with lots of loved ones, community holiday celebrations or trips to visit extended family: In any other year so many canceled plans would be unusual, but the rising Covid-19 case numbers have ensured that many people will have a socially distanced holiday season.

item.title: Zinedine Zidane hails Karim Benzema as the greatest French striker in history
item.description: France has a knack for producing some of football's greatest forwards.

item.title: Loneliness can help grow parts of brain tied to imagination, study finds
item.description: As many people face the prospect of being alone for the holidays, new science is showing how loneliness might actually help build structures in the brain tied to imagination.

item.title: Watch for the 'Christmas Star' as Jupiter and Saturn come closer than they have in centuries
item.description: The two largest planets in our solar system are coming closer together than they have been since the Middle Ages, and it's happening just in time for Christmas -- hence the nickname of the "Christmas Star."

item.title: Europe prepares for Christmas season like no other
item.description: • South Korea warns of first potential lockdown as numbers continue to rise • Covid updates: This 107-year-old woman beat Covid-19 • Germany shatters its record for Covid deaths

item.title: Germany shatters record for Covid deaths
item.description: Germany shattered its record for Covid-19 deaths in 24 hours on Tuesday with 952 patients dying compared to a previous record of 598 on December 11, according to the country's center for disease control.

item.title: South Korea's capital only has one ICU bed left
item.description: South Korean health officials have warned residents to take current restrictions seriously, as the country faces the possibility of entering into its first potential lockdown since the beginning of the pandemic amid an alarming rise in new infections.

item.title: McConnell has an 'election fraud' problem
item.description: • Analysis: McConnell pulls the floor out from defeated Trump • Kamala Harris reacts to McConnell's remarks • Avlon: 'Trump derangement syndrome' taken on a new twist

item.title: The Covid treatment you might not know
item.description: There are very few drugs that prevent people with early Covid-19 from progress to severe disease, but monoclonal antibodies may be among them.

item.title: Over two million children in Ethiopia's Tigray region cut off from humanitarian aid
item.description: The United Nations has warned that millions of children are still cut off from aid in Ethiopia's conflict-riven Tigray region, despite promises made by the federal government earlier this month to allow humanitarian agencies access.
